snippet.title: Walgreens Shoplifters Caught in the Act Downtown San Francisco (4K UHD)

localized.description:
I was walking downtown, past the mall on Market Street on my way to Ross, when I saw someone walk in who was obviously going to shoplift.  I followed him in, and discreetly kept an eye on him, meanwhile catching ANOTHER person shoplifting right next to him (I didn't know it at the time, I only found out when I was trying to edit.)  You can tell that the person in yellow (the homeless one) is not very experienced at stealing, because he makes no attempt at hiding the product, and hesitates before trying to leave the Walgreens.  Also, he spent a while looking in the toilet paper section before settling on the cheapest brand, the "Nice" brand (generic Walgreens brand.)
I think that it's interesting: you have two people of obviously different means shoplifting.  The one who is obviously more well off is stuffing his pockets with what look to be dress socks or deodorant/cologne, and doing it with swagger, and the homeless one is trying to steal the cheapest toilet paper he can find, and has difficulty going through with it.
